title: Issue 347
summary: Even more news around the MAUI RC

items.description:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #347 of Weekly Xamarin - a wrap-up of the community articles around Xamarin and MAUI communities this week.

Lots of articles about the MAUI Release Candidate this week and some good information if you are looking migrate your libraries across. Interestingly, Jon Skeet has been having a bit of a dig into the framework too.

Until next week, take care.

Kym
items.description_markdown:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #347 of Weekly Xamarin - a wrap-up of the community articles around Xamarin and MAUI communities this week.

Lots of articles about the MAUI Release Candidate this week and some good information if you are looking migrate your libraries across. Interestingly, Jon Skeet has been having a bit of a dig into the framework too.

Until next week, take care.

Kym

items.title: Figma Config 2022
items.description:
Config is Figma’s annual conference where users come together to learn from each other. This year, it’ll take place virtually over a 24 hour period. It's totally free to tune in, so if you enjoy good design you should check it out.

Figma Config 2022 by Figma
items.description_markdown:
Config is Figma’s annual conference where users come together to learn from each other. This year, it’ll take place virtually over a 24 hour period. It's totally free to tune in, so if you enjoy good design you should check it out.

items.title: Handling Overlay Elements in .NET MAUI with ZIndex | Syncfusion Blogs
items.description:
If you’re working in .NET MAUI, and you have two or more controls on top of each other that need to be revealed based on certain conditions, this article will undoubtedly assist you in handling that problem. The order in which an element appears on the z-axis is represented by ZIndex.

Handling Overlay Elements in .NET MAUI with ZIndex | Syncfusion Blogs by Jayaleshwari N
items.description_markdown:
If you’re working in .NET MAUI, and you have two or more controls on top of each other that need to be revealed based on certain conditions, this article will undoubtedly assist you in handling that problem. The order in which an element appears on the z-axis is represented by ZIndex.

[**Handling Overlay Elements in .NET MAUI with ZIndex | Syncfusion Blogs**](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/post/handling-overlay-elements-in-net-maui-with-zindex.aspx) by [Jayaleshwari N](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/author/jayaleshwarinsyncfusion-com)

embedded_links.title: **Handling Overlay Elements in .NET MAUI with ZIndex | Syncfusion Blogs**

items.title: .NET MAUI Release Candidates!
items.description:
.NET MAUI Release Candidate is here! With a "go live" license to boot! This means it is time to start building cross-platform native apps across iOS, Android, macOS, and Windows from a shared C# codebase! Today, I walkthrough everything you need to know to get started with the .NET MAUI Release Candidate on both Windows and on Mac with Visual Studio 2022.

.NET MAUI Release Candidates! by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
.NET MAUI Release Candidate is here! With a "go live" license to boot! This means it is time to start building cross-platform native apps across iOS, Android, macOS, and Windows from a shared C# codebase! Today, I walkthrough everything you need to know to get started with the .NET MAUI Release Candidate on both Windows and on Mac with Visual Studio 2022.

[**.NET MAUI Release Candidates!**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dIjF3bwEmgU) by [James Montemagno](https://twitter.com/jamesmontemagno)
